commit.message:
Improve news fragment file name parsing (#173)

The new version uses category as the reference point to later infer the
issue number and counter value.
As a consequence, it will return (None, None, None) if the base name
doesn't contain a valid category.

The new parser allows using file names like '123.feature.1.ext' which
are convenient when one wants to use an appropriate extension (e.g. rst,
md) to enable syntax highlighting.

verification.payload:
tree 5500d1b3f0851eadb354ab371e8dacce774e1b1d
parent fff788d80bf348809eab720fb56d00b2a217e6b5
author Tadej Janež <tadej.j@nez.si> 1586939205 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1586939205 -0700

Improve news fragment file name parsing (#173)

The new version uses category as the reference point to later infer the
issue number and counter value.
As a consequence, it will return (None, None, None) if the base name
doesn't contain a valid category.

The new parser allows using file names like '123.feature.1.ext' which
are convenient when one wants to use an appropriate extension (e.g. rst,
md) to enable syntax highlighting.

commit.message:
Fix formatting in README (#167)

Thanks to @blueyed for this.

Factor in #158 and clean up some configuration options (#162)

* ENH: Add no bullet point option

When `all_bullets` is set to false, then fragmets that should be
rendered as bullet points will have include the bullet itself.
In that case, bullets will be sorted to the front (bullets include
"*", "-", and "#." enumeration).
To make indentation of the ticket info easier, a `get_indent(text)`
function is exposed to the jinja template.

* testing and cleanups

verification.payload:
tree 044e62e530eb706b144d6a3dc60840f1f0379c88
parent 4068ee4a7e9aaca2f2fafb44665df5e4a1ec7aab
author Amber Brown <hawkowl@atleastfornow.net> 1568502684 +1000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1568502684 +1000

Factor in #158 and clean up some configuration options (#162)

* ENH: Add no bullet point option

When `all_bullets` is set to false, then fragmets that should be
rendered as bullet points will have include the bullet itself.
In that case, bullets will be sorted to the front (bullets include
"*", "-", and "#." enumeration).
To make indentation of the ticket info easier, a `get_indent(text)`
function is exposed to the jinja template.

* testing and cleanups

commit.message: Add a newsfragment
Allow specifying custom config file at the command line
fix
fixes

trivial: Resolve black issues

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>

Add 'towncrier create' command

Make it easy to create a news fragment for a given project without
having to figure out where they are stored.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
Closes: #4

Add subcommand support

Instead of having a single 'towncrier' command, add 'build' and 'check'
subcommands. The 'click-default-group' extension is used to allow us to
continue running the 'build' command by default, though we should look
at deprecating this in the future.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
Closes: #144

Move main command to 'build' module

For now, this simply lets us run the build command in the same way we
run the check command, namely:

    $ python -m towncrier.build

However, it will let us do far more powerful stuff shortly.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>

Resolve trivial nits

Probably a result of black'ification and not running flake8 on
'setup.py'.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
Add support for multiple dots within newsfragment filename
Extract parse_newfragment_basename()
Add test for non-numeric newsfragment names
Use dedent in TestCli.test_happy_path()
